content:
JR Moehringer is a scribe of great renown,
Whose biographies of famous folks doth astound,
Born in New York City, he doth cut his teeth
On tales of sports stars, and those of great wealth.

He studied at Yale, and learned the art,
Of weaving words, and playing with the heart,
His first book, "The Tender Bar," doth tell
Of his own upbringing, and the tales he doth dwell.

But it was his next work, "Open," that did bring
Him great success, as the ghostwriter of Tiger's swing,
And then he wrote "West of Memphis," a true crime story
And "Sutton" of the bank robber, a true tale of glory.

His writing is known for its depth and insight,
And his wit and humor, doth bring great delight,
He doth not shy away from tackling the tough,
And his ghostwriting skills, are second to none, as such.

So if thou art in search of a biographer grand,
JR Moehringer is the scribe at thy command,
His works doth entertain, and educate in equal measure,
And his ghostwriting skills, are beyond any treasure.
